title: Inside the £7.6million mansion Celine Dion shared with her late husband - which is now up for sale
text:
The Parisian mansion where Celine Dion nursed her late husband through his last days is up for sale – for a cool £7.6 million. 
With its five bedrooms, a wine cellar, a private spa and cinema room, the property is bound to attract plenty of attention from moneyed buyers. 
Celine has put her home on the market almost a day to the day after husband Rene Angelil died from throat cancer . 
The airy property has views of the Eiffel Tower and – as is normal with the homes of the rich and famous – 24-hour security. Celine and husband Rene, who were married for 21 years at the time of his death in January 2016 (Photo: AFP) Their four-storey Parisian home is in the upmarket neighbourhood of Villa Montmorency (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) It boasts views of the Eiffel Tower and its own garden (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) The happy couple even had their own home cinema room (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) 
Celine and Rene bought the secluded home in 2008, spending time there when Celine, 48, wasn't touring or performing her residency in Las Vegas. 
The couple had been married for 21 years when Rene died on January 14th 2016 at the age of 73. 
Opening up to Paris Match about the night Rene died, Celine said she'd missed his final moments as she'd been on stage performing. The mansion also features five bedrooms and bathrooms (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) It's currently on the market for £7.6million (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) A winding staircase links the four storeys of the house (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) 
Admitting that she'd been "haunted" by the idea that he'd hurt himself trying to find her, she revealed: "Rene wanted to die in my arms but, alas, I was singing that night. He must have wanted to get up and he fell on the floor. 
"Normally, after my show when he had taken his last medications, I gave him a kiss, tucking him in and sent him off to sleep," she went on. 
"That evening I didn't want to wake him. It was the nurse who found him the next day. Distraught, she came to find me. I went into the room." The mezzanine level has its own mini-library (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) The balcony looks over the property's leafy garden (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) Along with its own private garden, the mansion has a spa, wine cellar and 24-hour security (Photo: Exclusivepix Media) 
When doctors examined Rene, they found no sign of injury – so Celine was finally able to find peace with his death. Like us on Facebook
